intro: Linconia cuspidata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually pink or red, with five petals and a prominent central column. Linconia cuspidata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to well-drained soils and full sun.
